list.exp: 歌词都夹杂英式伦敦话
list.abs: ...或许他们最像的就是摇滚先锋-Buzzcocks(吵闹公鸡乐团)了。他们大部份的歌词都夹杂英式伦敦话(cockey)，而且用着近乎酒醉的含糊嗓音唱出英式生活的味道.

entry.def: If you say that an idea or scheme is cockeyed, you mean that you think it is very unlikely to succeed.

example.ex: She has some cockeyed delusions about becoming a pop star.
example.tran: 她还幻想着自己能成为流行歌星。

entry.def: If something is cockeyed, it looks wrong because it is not in a level or straight position.

example.ex: ...dusty photographs hanging at cockeyed angles on the walls.
example.tran: 歪挂在墙上、布满灰尘的照片

means.word_mean: 1. turned or twisted toward one side;

sentences.sentence: "a...youth with a gorgeous red necktie all awry"- G.K.Chesterton
"his wig was, as the British say, skew-whiff"

means.word_mean: 2. completely devoid of wisdom or good sense;

sentences.sentence: "the absurd excuse that the dog ate his homework"
"ask a nonsensical question and get a nonsensical answer"
"a contribution so small as to be laughable"
"it is ludicrous to call a cottage a mansion"
"a preposterous attempt to turn back the pages of history"
"her conceited assumption of universal interest in her rather dull children was ridiculous"

list.explanation: 疯疯癫癫的，古怪的，完全错误的

example.en: If you didn't act so cockeyed all the time, you'd have more friends.
example.zh: 如果你的行为不那么古里古怪，那你会有更多的朋友。

example.en: This plan appears to be completely cockeyed.
example.zh: 看来这个计划是完全错误的。

example.en: He put his hat on cockeyed and got chuckle.
example.zh: 他的帽子戴得歪歪斜斜，惹笑。
